org.accada.epcis.repository.query
Class QueryOperationsBackendSQL

java.lang.Object
  org.accada.epcis.repository.query.QueryOperationsBackendSQL
All Implemented Interfaces:
QueryOperationsBackend
public class QueryOperationsBackendSQL
extends java.lang.Object
implements QueryOperationsBackend

The QueryOperationsBackendSQL uses basic SQL statements (actually PreparedStatements) to implement the QueryOperationsBackend interface.

Author:
Marco Steybe

Method Detail

runSimpleEventQuery

public void runSimpleEventQuery(QueryOperationsSession session,
                                SimpleEventQueryDTO seQuery,
                                java.util.List<java.lang.Object> eventList)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                ImplementationExceptionResponse,
                                QueryTooLargeExceptionResponse
Executes a simple event query with the parameters given in the SimpleEventQueryDTO. The resulting event list will be available in the given eventList parameter.

Specified by:
runSimpleEventQuery in interface QueryOperationsBackend
Parameters:
session - The QueryOperationsSession wrapping a database connection.
seQuery - The SimpleEventQueryDTO containing the query parameters from which the database query will be constructed.
eventList - A List of events matching the given query parameters.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error with the database occurred.
ImplementationExceptionResponse - If an implementation specific error occurred.
QueryTooLargeExceptionResponse - If the query is too large to be executed.

runMasterDataQuery

public void runMasterDataQuery(QueryOperationsSession session,
                               MasterDataQueryDTO mdQuery,
                               java.util.List<VocabularyType> vocList)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException,
                               ImplementationExceptionResponse,
                               QueryTooLargeExceptionResponse
Executes a masterdata query with the parameters given in the MasterDataQueryDTO. The resulting vocabulary list will be available in the given vocList parameter.

Specified by:
runMasterDataQuery in interface QueryOperationsBackend
Parameters:
session - The QueryOperationsSession wrapping a database connection.
mdQuery - The MasterDataQueryDTO containing the query parameters from which the database query will be constructed.
vocList - A List of vocabularies matching the given query parameters.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error with the database occurred.
ImplementationExceptionResponse - If an implementation specific error occurred.
QueryTooLargeExceptionResponse - If the query is too large to be executed.

                                         java.lang.String subscriptionID)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
Checks if the given subscription ID already exists.

Specified by:
fetchExistsSubscriptionId in interface QueryOperationsBackend
Parameters:
session - The QueryOperationsSession wrapping a database connection.
subscriptionID - The subscription ID to be checked.
Returns:
true if the given subscription ID already exists, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error with the database occurred.

fetchSubscriptions

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,QuerySubscriptionScheduled> fetchSubscriptions(QueryOperationsSession session)
                                                                              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                                     ImplementationExceptionResponse
Fetches all query subscription held in the database, starts them again and stores everything in a HasMap.

Specified by:
fetchSubscriptions in interface QueryOperationsBackend
Parameters:
session - The QueryOperationsSession wrapping a database connection.
Returns:
A Map mapping query names to scheduled query subscriptions.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error with the database occurred.
ImplementationExceptionResponse - If an implementation specific error occurred.
